custom_commands_path.description: Location(s) where custom commands will be loaded from.

custom_assertions_path.description: Location(s) where custom assertions will be loaded from.

page_objects_path.description: Location(s) where page object files will be loaded from.

globals_path.description: Location of an external globals module which will be loaded and made available to the test as a property globals on the main client instance.

globals.description: An object which will be made available on the main test api, throughout the test execution

abortOnAssertionFailure.description: This controls whether to abort the test execution when an assertion failed and skip the rest. It's being used in waitFor commands and expect assertions

abortOnElementLocateError.description: This controls whether to abort the test execution when an element cannot be located; an error is logged in all cases, but this also enables skipping the rest of the testcase; It's being used in element commands such as .click() or .getText()

waitForConditionPollInterval.description: This will overwrite the default polling interval (currently 500ms) for waitFor commands and expect assertions that use retry

waitForConditionTimeout.description: Default timeout value in milliseconds for waitFor commands and implicit waitFor value for expect assertions

throwOnMultipleElementsReturned.description: This will cause waitFor commands on elements to throw an error if multiple elements are found using the given locate strategy and selector

suppressWarningsOnMultipleElementsReturn.description: By default a warning is printed if multiple elements are found using the given locate strategy and selector; set this to true to suppress those warnings

asyncHookTimeout.description: Controls the timeout value for async hooks. Expects the done() callback to be invoked within this time or an error is thrown

unitTestsTimeout.description: Controls the timeout value for when running async unit tests. Expects the done() callback to be invoked within this time or an error is thrown

customReporterCallbackTimeout.description: Controls the timeout value for when executing the global async reporter. Expects the done() callback to be invoked within this time or an error is thrown

retryAssertionTimeout.description: Automatically retrying failed assertions - You can tell Nightwatch to automatically retry failed assertions until a given timeout is reached, before the test runner gives up and fails the test.

dotenv.description: Configuration settings for the dotenv module - a zero-dependency module that loads environment variables from a .env file into process.env. More details on https://www.npmjs.com/package/dotenv

persist_globals.description: Persist the same globals object between runs or have a (deep) copy of it per each test; this can be useful when persisting data between test suites is needed, such as a cookie or session information

output_folder.description: The location where the JUnit XML report files will be saved. Set this to false if you want to disable XML reporting

src_folders.description: A string or array of folders (excluding subfolders) where the tests are located.

live_output.description: Used when running in parallel to determine if the output should be collected and displayed at the end.

disable_colors.description: Used to disable colored output in the terminal.

parallel_process_delay.description: Used when running in parallel to specify the delay (in milliseconds) between starting the child processes

selenium.description: An object containing Selenium Server related configuration options

start_session.description: Whether or not to automatically start the Selenium/WebDriver session. If running unit tests, this should be set tot false.

end_session_on_fail.description: End the session automatically when the test is being terminated, usually after a failed assertion.

skip_testcases_on_fail.description: Skip the remaining test cases from the current test suite, when one test case fails.

test_workers.description: Whether or not to run individual test files in parallel.

workers.description: Automatically compute the number of workers based on CPU cores with "auto" or manually specify the number of workers

node_options.description: Pass node arguments to individual workers (all of the process.execArgv using "auto" or selectively pass node arguments via ["--inspect"])

test_runner.description: Specifies which test runner to use: default|mocha

webdriver.description: Defines options used to connect to the WebDriver/Selenium server

check_process_delay.description: Time to wait (in ms) before starting to check the Webdriver server is up and running

max_status_poll_tries.description: Maximum number of ping status check attempts before returning a timeout error

status_poll_interval.description: Interval (in ms) to use between status ping checks when checking if the Webdriver server is up and running

process_create_timeout.description: The entire time (in ms) to wait for the Node.js process to be created and running (default is 2 min), including spawning the child process and checking the status

launch_url.description: A url which can be used later in the tests as the main url to load.

silent.description: set to false if you want to show the extended http traffic command logs from the WebDriver server.

output.description: Used to disable terminal output completely.

detailed_output.description: Set this to false if you'd like to only see the test case name displayed and pass/fail status.

output_timestamp.description: Set this to true if you'd like to see timestamps next to the logging output

disable_error_log.description: Set this to true if you'd like to not display errors during the execution of the test (they are shown at the end always).

screenshots.description: Take error and failure screenshots during test execution

log_screenshot_data.description: Used to enable showing the Base64 image data in the (verbose) log when taking screenshots.

exclude.description: An array of folders or file patterns to be skipped (relative to the main source folder).

filter.description: Folder or file pattern to be used when loading the tests. Files that don't match this pattern will be ignored.

skipgroup.description: Skip a group of tests (a subfolder); can be a list of comma-separated values (no space)

skiptags.description: Skip tests by tag name; can be a list of comma-separated values (no space)

use_xpath.description: Use xpath as the default locator strategy
